options.name: metrics_path
options.description: Set the metrics URI endpoint, it must start with a forward slash.

options.name: path
options.description: pattern specifying log files or multiple ones through the use of common wildcards.

options.name: exclude_path
options.description: Set one or multiple shell patterns separated by commas to exclude files matching a certain criteria, e.g: 'exclude_path *.gz,*.zip'

options.name: key
options.description: when a message is unstructured (no parser applied), it's appended as a string under the key name log. This option allows to define an alternative name for that key.

options.name: read_from_head
options.description: For new discovered files on start (without a database offset/position), read the content from the head of the file, not tail.

options.name: refresh_interval
options.description: interval to refresh the list of watched files expressed in seconds.

options.name: rotate_wait
options.description: specify the number of extra time in seconds to monitor a file once is rotated in case some pending data is flushed.

options.name: docker_mode
options.description: If enabled, the plugin will recombine split Docker log lines before passing them to any parser as configured above. This mode cannot be used at the same time as Multiline.

options.name: docker_mode_flush
options.description: wait period time in seconds to flush queued unfinished split lines.

options.name: docker_mode_parser
options.description: specify the parser name to fetch log first line for muliline log

options.name: path_key
options.description: set the 'key' name where the name of monitored file will be appended.

options.name: offset_key
options.description: set the 'key' name where the offset of monitored file will be appended.

options.name: ignore_older
options.description: ignore files older than 'ignore_older'. Supports m,h,d (minutes, hours, days) syntax. Default behavior is to read all the files.

options.name: buffer_chunk_size
options.description: set the initial buffer size to read data from files. This value is used too to increase buffer size.

options.name: buffer_max_size
options.description: set the limit of the buffer size per monitored file. When a buffer needs to be increased (e.g: very long lines), this value is used to restrict how much the memory buffer can grow. If reading a file exceed this limit, the file is removed from the monitored file list.

options.name: static_batch_size
options.description: On start, Fluent Bit might process files which already contains data, these files are called 'static' files. The configuration property in question set's the maximum number of bytes to process per iteration for the static files monitored.

options.name: event_batch_size
options.description: When Fluent Bit is processing files in event based mode the amount ofdata available for consumption could be too much and cause the input plugin to over extend and smother other pluginsThe configuration property sets the maximum number of bytes to process per iteration for the files monitored (in event mode).

options.name: skip_long_lines
options.description: if a monitored file reach it buffer capacity due to a very long line (buffer_max_size), the default behavior is to stop monitoring that file. This option alter that behavior and instruct Fluent Bit to skip long lines and continue processing other lines that fits into the buffer.

options.name: exit_on_eof
options.description: exit Fluent Bit when reaching EOF on a monitored file.

options.name: skip_empty_lines
options.description: Allows to skip empty lines.

options.name: inotify_watcher
options.description: set to false to use file stat watcher instead of inotify.

options.name: parser
options.description: specify the parser name to process an unstructured message.

options.name: tag_regex
options.description: set a regex to extract fields from the file name and use them later to compose the Tag.

options.name: db
options.description: set a database file to keep track of monitored files and it offsets.

options.name: db.sync
options.description: set a database sync method. values: extra, full, normal and off.

options.name: db.locking
options.description: set exclusive locking mode, increase performance but don't allow external connections to the database file.

options.name: db.journal_mode
options.description: Option to provide WAL configuration for Work Ahead Logging mechanism (WAL). Enabling WAL provides higher performance. Note that WAL is not compatible with shared network file systems.

options.name: multiline
options.description: if enabled, the plugin will try to discover multiline messages and use the proper parsers to compose the outgoing messages. Note that when this option is enabled the Parser option is not used.

options.name: multiline_flush
options.description: wait period time in seconds to process queued multiline messages.

options.name: parser_firstline
options.description: name of the parser that matches the beginning of a multiline message. Note that the regular expression defined in the parser must include a group name (named capture).

options.name: parser_
options.description: optional extra parser to interpret and structure multiline entries. This option can be used to define multiple parsers, e.g: Parser_1 ab1, Parser_2 ab2, Parser_N abN.

options.name: multiline.parser
options.description: specify one or multiple multiline parsers: docker, cri, go, java, etc.

options.name: samples
options.description: set a number of times to generate event.

options.name: dummy
options.description: set the sample record to be generated. It should be a JSON object.

options.name: metadata
options.description: set the sample metadata to be generated. It should be a JSON object.

options.name: rate
options.description: set a number of events per second.

options.name: copies
options.description: set the number of copies to generate per collectd.

options.name: start_time_sec
options.description: set a dummy base timestamp in seconds.

options.name: start_time_nsec
options.description: set a dummy base timestamp in nanoseconds.

options.name: fixed_timestamp
options.description: used a fixed timestamp, allows the message to pre-generated once.

options.description: Specifies which version of the EC2 instance metadata service will be used: 'v1' or 'v2'. 'v2' may not work if you run Fluent Bit in a container.

options.name: az
options.description: Enable EC2 instance availability zone

options.name: ec2_instance_id
options.description: Enable EC2 instance ID

options.name: ec2_instance_type
options.description: Enable EC2 instance type

options.name: private_ip
options.description: Enable EC2 instance private IP

options.description: Enable EC2 instance VPC ID

options.name: hostname
options.description: Enable EC2 instance hostname

options.name: tags_enabled
options.description: Enable EC2 instance tags, injects all tags if tags_include and tags_exclude are empty

options.name: tags_include
options.description: Defines list of specific EC2 tag keys to inject into the logs; tag keys must be separated by "," character; tags which are not present in this list will be ignored; e.g.: "Name,tag1,tag2"

options.name: tags_exclude
options.description: Defines list of specific EC2 tag keys not to inject into the logs; tag keys must be separated by "," character; if both tags_include and tags_exclude are specified, configuration is invalid and plugin fails

options.name: file
options.description: Specify the file that contains the patterns to lookup.

options.name: mode
options.description: Set the check mode: 'exact' or 'partial'.

options.name: print_query_time
options.description: Print to stdout the elapseed query time for every matched record

options.name: ignore_case
options.description: Compare strings by ignoring case.

options.name: lookup_key
options.description: Name of the key to lookup.

options.name: record
options.description: Name of record key to add and its value, it accept two values,e.g 'record mykey my val'. You can add many 'record' entries as needed.

options.name: add
options.description: Add a metadata key/value pair with the given key and given value from the given template. Format is `Add KEY TEMPLATE`.

options.name: ecs_tag_prefix
options.description: This filter must obtain the 12 character container short ID to query for ECS Task metadata. The filter removes the prefx from the tag and then assumes the next 12 characters are the short container ID. If the container short ID, is not found in the tag, the filter can/must fallback to only attaching cluster metadata (cluster name, container instance ID/ARN, and ECS Agent version).

options.name: cluster_metadata_only
options.description: Only attempt to attach the cluster related metadata to logs (cluster name, container instance ID/ARN, and ECS Agent version). With this option off, if this filter can not obtain the task metadata for a log, it will output errors. Use this option if you have logs that are not part of an ECS task (ex: Docker Daemon logs).

options.name: ecs_meta_cache_ttl
options.description: Configurable TTL for cached ECS Task Metadata. Default 3600s (1 hour)For example, set this value to 600 or 600s or 10m and cache entries which have been created more than 10 minutes will be evicted.Cache eviction is needed to purge task metadata for tasks that have been stopped.

options.name: ecs_meta_host
options.description: The host name at which the ECS Agent Introspection endpoint is reachable. Defaults to 127.0.0.1

options.name: ecs_meta_port
options.description: The port at which the ECS Agent Introspection endpoint is reachable. Defaults to 51678

options.name: agent_endpoint_retries
options.description: Number of retries for failed metadata requests to ECS Agent Introspection endpoint. The most common cause of failed metadata requests is that the container the metadata request was made for is not part of an ECS Task. Check if you have non-task containers and docker dual logging enabled.

options.name: record
options.description: Append fields. This parameter needs key and value pair.

options.name: remove_key
options.description: If the key is matched, that field is removed.

options.name: allowlist_key

options.name: whitelist_key

options.name: uuid_key

options.name: merge_log_trim

options.name: keep_log

options.description: allow Pods to suggest a parser

options.description: allow Pods to exclude themselves from the logging pipeline

options.name: use_journal
options.description: use Journald (Systemd) mode

options.name: regex_parser
options.description: optional regex parser to extract metadata from container name or container log file name

options.name: dummy_meta

options.description: dns lookup retries N times until the network start working

options.description: dns interval between network status checks

options.name: cache_use_docker_id
options.description: fetch K8s meta when docker_id is changed

options.description: use kubelet to get metadata instead of kube-server

options.name: kubelet_port
options.description: kubelet port to connect with when using kubelet

options.name: kube_token_ttl
options.description: kubernetes token ttl, until it is reread from the token file. Default: 10m

options.name: kube_meta_cache_ttl
options.description: configurable TTL for K8s cached metadata. By default, it is set to 0 which means TTL for cache entries is disabled and cache entries are evicted at random when capacity is reached. In order to enable this option, you should set the number to a time interval. For example, set this value to 60 or 60s and cache entries which have been created more than 60s will be evicted

options.name: Set
options.description: Add a key/value pair with key KEY and value VALUE. If KEY already exists, this field is overwritten.

options.name: Add
options.description: Add a key/value pair with key KEY and value VALUE if KEY does not exist

options.name: Remove
options.description: Remove a key/value pair with key KEY if it exists

options.name: Remove_wildcard
options.description: Remove all key/value pairs with key matching wildcard KEY

options.name: Remove_regex
options.description: Remove all key/value pairs with key matching regexp KEY

options.name: Move_To_Start
options.description: Move key/value pairs with keys matching KEY to the start of the message

options.name: Move_To_End
options.description: Move key/value pairs with keys matching KEY to the end of the message

options.name: Rename
options.description: Rename a key/value pair with key KEY to RENAMED_KEY if KEY exists AND RENAMED_KEY does not exist

options.name: Hard_Rename
options.description: Rename a key/value pair with key KEY to RENAMED_KEY if KEY exists. If RENAMED_KEY already exists, this field is overwritten

options.name: Copy
options.description: Copy a key/value pair with key KEY to COPIED_KEY if KEY exists AND COPIED_KEY does not exist

options.name: Hard_copy
options.description: Copy a key/value pair with key KEY to COPIED_KEY if KEY exists. If COPIED_KEY already exists, this field is overwritten

options.name: Condition
options.description: Set the condition to modify. Key_exists, Key_does_not_exist, A_key_matches, No_key_matches, Key_value_equals, Key_value_does_not_equal, Key_value_matches, Key_value_does_not_match, Matching_keys_have_matching_values and Matching_keys_do_not_have_matching_values are supported.

options.name: debug_flush
options.description: enable debugging for concatenation flush to stdout

options.name: buffer
options.description: Enable buffered mode. In buffered mode, the filter can concatenate multilines from inputs that ingest records one by one (ex: Forward), rather than in chunks, re-emitting them into the beggining of the pipeline using the in_emitter instance. With buffer off, this filter will not work with most inputs, except tail.

options.name: mode
options.description: Mode can be 'parser' for regex concat, or 'partial_message' to concat split docker logs.

options.name: flush_ms
options.description: Flush time for pending multiline records

options.name: multiline.parser
options.description: specify one or multiple multiline parsers: docker, cri, go, java, etc.

options.name: multiline.key_content
options.description: specify the key name that holds the content to process.

options.name: emitter_mem_buf_limit
options.description: set a memory buffer limit to restrict memory usage of emitter

options.name: Operation

options.name: Wildcard
options.description: Nest records which field matches the wildcard

options.description: Nest records matching the Wildcard under this key

options.name: Nested_under
options.description: Lift records nested under the Nested_under key

options.name: Add_prefix
options.description: Prefix affected keys with this string

options.name: Remove_prefix
options.description: Remove prefix from affected keys if it matches this string

options.name: Key_Name
options.description: Specify field name in record to parse.

options.name: Parser
options.description: Specify the parser name to interpret the field. Multiple Parser entries are allowed (one per line).

options.name: Preserve_Key
options.description: Keep original Key_Name field in the parsed result. If false, the field will be removed.

options.name: Reserve_Data
options.description: Keep all other original fields in the parsed result. If false, all other original fields will be removed.

options.name: Unescape_key
options.description: (deprecated)

options.name: key_exists
options.description: check that the given key name exists in the record

options.name: key_not_exists
options.description: check that the given key name do not exists in the record

options.name: key_val_is_null
options.description: check that the value of the key is NULL

options.name: key_val_is_not_null
options.description: check that the value of the key is NOT NULL

options.name: key_val_eq
options.description: check that the value of the key equals the given value

options.name: action

options.name: result_key
options.description: specify the key name to append a boolean that indicates rule is matched or not. This key is to be used only when 'action' is 'result_key'.

filters.name: grep

options.description: Keep records in which the content of KEY matches the regular expression.

options.name: exclude
options.description: Exclude records in which the content of KEY matches the regular expression.

options.name: logical_op
options.description: Specify whether to use logical conjuciton or disjunction. legacy, AND and OR are allowed.

options.name: emitter_mem_buf_limit
options.description: set a memory buffer limit to restrict memory usage of emitter

options.name: regex

options.description: Set an index name

options.description: Set the document type property

options.description: If true, mapping types is removed. (for v7.0.0 or later)

options.description: Optional username credential for Elastic X-Pack access

options.name: http_passwd
options.description: Password for user defined in HTTP_User

options.name: compress
options.description: Set payload compression mechanism. Option available is 'gzip'

options.name: cloud_id
options.description: Elastic cloud ID of the cluster to connect to

options.name: cloud_auth
options.description: Elastic cloud authentication credentials

options.name: aws_auth
options.description: Enable AWS Sigv4 Authentication

options.name: aws_region
options.description: AWS Region of your Amazon OpenSearch Service cluster

options.name: aws_sts_endpoint
options.description: Custom endpoint for the AWS STS API, used with the AWS_Role_ARN option

options.name: aws_role_arn
options.description: AWS IAM Role to assume to put records to your Amazon OpenSearch cluster

options.name: aws_external_id
options.description: External ID for the AWS IAM Role specified with `aws_role_arn`

options.name: aws_service_name
options.description: AWS Service Name

options.name: aws_profile
options.description: AWS Profile name. AWS Profiles can be configured with AWS CLI and are usually stored in $HOME/.aws/ directory.

options.name: logstash_format
options.description: Enable Logstash format compatibility

options.name: logstash_prefix
options.description: When Logstash_Format is enabled, the Index name is composed using a prefix and the date, e.g: If Logstash_Prefix is equals to 'mydata' your index will become 'mydata-YYYY.MM.DD'. The last string appended belongs to the date when the data is being generated

options.name: logstash_prefix_separator
options.description: Set a separator between logstash_prefix and date.

options.name: logstash_prefix_key
options.description: When included: the value in the record that belongs to the key will be looked up and over-write the Logstash_Prefix for index generation. If the key/value is not found in the record then the Logstash_Prefix option will act as a fallback. Nested keys are supported through record accessor pattern

options.name: logstash_dateformat
options.description: Time format (based on strftime) to generate the second part of the Index name

options.name: time_key
options.description: When Logstash_Format is enabled, each record will get a new timestamp field. The Time_Key property defines the name of that field

options.name: time_key_format
options.description: When Logstash_Format is enabled, this property defines the format of the timestamp

options.name: time_key_nanos
options.description: When Logstash_Format is enabled, enabling this property sends nanosecond precision timestamps

options.name: include_tag_key
options.description: When enabled, it append the Tag name to the record

options.name: tag_key
options.description: When Include_Tag_Key is enabled, this property defines the key name for the tag

options.name: buffer_size
options.description: Specify the buffer size used to read the response from the Elasticsearch HTTP service. This option is useful for debugging purposes where is required to read full responses, note that response size grows depending of the number of records inserted. To set an unlimited amount of memory set this value to 'false', otherwise the value must be according to the Unit Size specification

options.name: path
options.description: Elasticsearch accepts new data on HTTP query path '/_bulk'. But it is also possible to serve Elasticsearch behind a reverse proxy on a subpath. This option defines such path on the fluent-bit side. It simply adds a path prefix in the indexing HTTP POST URI

options.name: pipeline
options.description: Newer versions of Elasticsearch allows to setup filters called pipelines. This option allows to define which pipeline the database should use. For performance reasons is strongly suggested to do parsing and filtering on Fluent Bit side, avoid pipelines

options.name: generate_id
options.description: When enabled, generate _id for outgoing records. This prevents duplicate records when retrying ES

options.name: write_operation
options.description: Operation to use to write in bulk requests

options.name: id_key
options.description: If set, _id will be the value of the key from incoming record.

options.name: replace_dots
options.description: When enabled, replace field name dots with underscore, required by Elasticsearch 2.0-2.3.

options.name: current_time_index
options.description: Use current time for index generation instead of message record

options.name: trace_output
options.description: When enabled print the Elasticsearch API calls to stdout (for diag only)

options.name: trace_error
options.description: When enabled print the Elasticsearch exception to stderr (for diag only)

options.name: tenant_id
options.description: Tenant ID used by default to push logs to Loki. If omitted or empty it assumes Loki is running in single-tenant mode and no X-Scope-OrgID header is sent.

options.name: tenant_id_key
options.description: If set, X-Scope-OrgID will be the value of the key from incoming record. It is useful to set X-Scode-OrgID dynamically.

options.name: labels
options.description: labels for API requests. If no value is set, the default label is 'job=fluent-bit'

options.name: auto_kubernetes_labels
options.description: If set to true, it will add all Kubernetes labels to Loki labels.

options.name: drop_single_key
options.description: If set to true and only a single key remains, the log line sent to Loki will be the value of that key.

options.name: label_keys
options.description: Comma separated list of keys to use as stream labels.

options.name: remove_keys
options.description: Comma separated list of keys to remove.

options.name: line_format
options.description: Format to use when flattening the record to a log line. Valid values are 'json' or 'key_value'. If set to 'json' the log line sent to Loki will be the Fluent Bit record dumped as json. If set to 'key_value', the log line will be each item in the record concatenated together (separated by a single space) in the format '='.

options.name: label_map_path
options.description: A label map file path

options.name: http_user
options.description: Set HTTP auth user

options.name: http_passwd
options.description: Set HTTP auth password

options.name: bearer_token
options.description: Set bearer token auth

options.description: Enable AWS Sigv4 Authentication

options.description: AWS Region of your Amazon OpenSearch Service cluster

options.description: AWS Profile name. AWS Profiles can be configured with AWS CLI and are usually stored in $HOME/.aws/ directory.

options.name: aws_sts_endpoint
options.description: Custom endpoint for the AWS STS API, used with the AWS_Role_ARN option

options.description: AWS IAM Role to assume to put records to your Amazon OpenSearch cluster

options.name: aws_service_name
options.description: AWS Service Name

options.name: logstash_format
options.description: Enable Logstash format compatibility

options.name: logstash_prefix
options.description: When Logstash_Format is enabled, the Index name is composed using a prefix and the date, e.g: If Logstash_Prefix is equals to 'mydata' your index will become 'mydata-YYYY.MM.DD'. The last string appended belongs to the date when the data is being generated

options.name: logstash_prefix_separator
options.description: Set a separator between logstash_prefix and date.

options.name: logstash_prefix_key
options.description: When included: the value in the record that belongs to the key will be looked up and over-write the Logstash_Prefix for index generation. If the key/value is not found in the record then the Logstash_Prefix option will act as a fallback. Nested keys are supported through record accessor pattern

options.name: logstash_dateformat
options.description: Time format (based on strftime) to generate the second part of the Index name

options.name: time_key
options.description: When Logstash_Format is enabled, each record will get a new timestamp field. The Time_Key property defines the name of that field

options.name: time_key_format
options.description: When Logstash_Format is enabled, this property defines the format of the timestamp

options.name: time_key_nanos
options.description: When Logstash_Format is enabled, enabling this property sends nanosecond precision timestamps

options.name: include_tag_key
options.description: When enabled, it append the Tag name to the record

options.name: tag_key
options.description: When Include_Tag_Key is enabled, this property defines the key name for the tag

options.name: buffer_size
options.description: Specify the buffer size used to read the response from the OpenSearch HTTP service. This option is useful for debugging purposes where is required to read full responses, note that response size grows depending of the number of records inserted. To set an unlimited amount of memory set this value to 'false', otherwise the value must be according to the Unit Size specification

options.name: path
options.description: OpenSearch accepts new data on HTTP query path '/_bulk'. But it is also possible to serve OpenSearch behind a reverse proxy on a subpath. This option defines such path on the fluent-bit side. It simply adds a path prefix in the indexing HTTP POST URI

options.name: pipeline
options.description: OpenSearch allows to setup filters called pipelines. This option allows to define which pipeline the database should use. For performance reasons is strongly suggested to do parsing and filtering on Fluent Bit side, avoid pipelines

options.name: generate_id
options.description: When enabled, generate _id for outgoing records. This prevents duplicate records when retrying

options.name: write_operation
options.description: Operation to use to write in bulk requests

options.name: id_key
options.description: If set, _id will be the value of the key from incoming record.

options.name: replace_dots
options.description: When enabled, replace field name dots with underscore.

options.name: current_time_index
options.description: Use current time for index generation instead of message record

options.name: trace_output
options.description: When enabled print the OpenSearch API calls to stdout (for diag only)

options.name: trace_error
options.description: When enabled print the OpenSearch exception to stderr (for diag only)

options.name: compress
options.description: Set payload compression mechanism. Option available is 'gzip'

options.name: http_buffer_size
options.description: Specify the buffer size used to read the response from the Splunk HTTP service. This option is useful for debugging purposes where is required to read full responses, note that response size grows depending of the number of records inserted. To set an unlimited amount of memory set this value to 'false', otherwise the value must be according to the Unit Size specification

options.name: http_debug_bad_request
options.description: If the HTTP server response code is 400 (bad request) and this flag is enabled, it will print the full HTTP request and response to the stdout interface. This feature is available for debugging purposes.

options.name: event_key
options.description: Specify the key name that will be used to send a single value as part of the record.

options.name: event_host
options.description: Set the host value to the event data. The value allows a record accessor pattern.

options.name: event_source
options.description: Set the source value to assign to the event data.

options.name: event_sourcetype
options.description: Set the sourcetype value to assign to the event data.

options.name: event_sourcetype_key
options.description: Set a record key that will populate 'sourcetype'. If the key is found, it will have precedence over the value set in 'event_sourcetype'.

options.name: event_index
options.description: The name of the index by which the event data is to be indexed.

options.name: event_index_key
options.description: Set a record key that will populate the 'index' field. If the key is found, it will have precedence over the value set in 'event_index'.

options.name: event_field
options.description: Set event fields for the record. This option can be set multiple times and the format is 'key_name record_accessor_pattern'.

options.name: splunk_token
options.description: Specify the Authentication Token for the HTTP Event Collector interface.

options.name: splunk_send_raw
options.description: When enabled, the record keys and values are set in the top level of the map instead of under the event key. Refer to the Sending Raw Events section from the docs for more details to make this option work properly.

options.name: channel
options.description: Specify X-Splunk-Request-Channel Header for the HTTP Event Collector interface.

options.name: mode
options.description: Set the desired transport type, the available options are tcp and udp. If you need to use a TLS secure channel, choose 'tcp' mode here and enable the 'tls' option separately.

options.name: syslog_format
options.description: Specify the Syslog protocol format to use, the available options are rfc3164 and rfc5424.

options.name: syslog_maxsize
options.description: Set the maximum size allowed per message. The value must be only integers representing the number of bytes allowed. If no value is provided, the default size is set depending of the protocol version specified by syslog_format , rfc3164 sets max size to 1024 bytes, while rfc5424 sets the size to 2048 bytes.

options.name: syslog_severity_key
options.description: Specify the name of the key from the original record that contains the Syslog severity number. This configuration is optional.

options.name: syslog_severity_preset
options.description: Specify the preset severity number. It must be 0-7.  This configuration is optional.

options.name: syslog_facility_key
options.description: Specify the name of the key from the original record that contains the Syslog facility number. This configuration is optional.

options.name: syslog_facility_preset
options.description: Specify the preset facility number. It must be 0-23.  This configuration is optional.

options.name: syslog_hostname_key
options.description: Specify the key name from the original record that contains the hostname that generated the message. This configuration is optional.

options.name: syslog_hostname_preset
options.description: Specify the preset hostname. This configuration is optional.

options.name: syslog_appname_key
options.description: Specify the key name from the original record that contains the application name that generated the message. This configuration is optional.

options.name: syslog_appname_preset
options.description: Specify the preset appname. This configuration is optional.

options.name: syslog_procid_key
options.description: Specify the key name from the original record that contains the Process ID that generated the message. This configuration is optional.

options.name: syslog_procid_preset
options.description: Specify the preset procid.  This configuration is optional.

options.name: syslog_msgid_key
options.description: Specify the key name from the original record that contains the Message ID associated to the message. This configuration is optional.

options.name: syslog_msgid_preset
options.description: Specify the preset msgid. This configuration is optional.

options.name: syslog_sd_key
options.description: Specify the key name from the original record that contains the Structured Data (SD) content. If set, the value of the key must be a map.This option can be set multiple times.

options.name: syslog_message_key
options.description: Specify the key name that contains the message to deliver. Note that if this property is mandatory, otherwise the message will be empty.

options.name: allow_longer_sd_id
options.description: If true, Fluent-bit allows SD-ID that is longer than 32 characters. Such long SD-ID violates RFC 5424.

options.name: region
options.description: The AWS region to send logs to

options.name: log_group_name
options.description: CloudWatch Log Group Name

options.name: log_stream_name
options.description: CloudWatch Log Stream Name; not compatible with `log_stream_prefix`

options.name: log_stream_prefix
options.description: Prefix for CloudWatch Log Stream Name; the tag is appended to the prefix to form the stream name

options.name: log_group_template
options.description: Template for CW Log Group name using record accessor syntax. Plugin falls back to the log_group_name configured if needed.

options.name: log_stream_template
options.description: Template for CW Log Stream name using record accessor syntax. Plugin falls back to the log_stream_name or log_stream_prefix configured if needed.

options.name: log_key
options.description: By default, the whole log record will be sent to CloudWatch. If you specify a key name with this option, then only the value of that key will be sent to CloudWatch. For example, if you are using the Fluentd Docker log driver, you can specify log_key log and only the log message will be sent to CloudWatch.

options.name: extra_user_agent
options.description: This option appends a string to the default user agent. AWS asks that you not manually set this field yourself, it is reserved for use in our vended configurations, for example, EKS Container Insights.

options.name: log_format
options.description: An optional parameter that can be used to tell CloudWatch the format of the data. A value of json/emf enables CloudWatch to extract custom metrics embedded in a JSON payload.

options.name: role_arn
options.description: ARN of an IAM role to assume (ex. for cross account access).

options.name: auto_create_group
options.description: Automatically create the log group (log streams will always automatically be created)

options.name: auto_retry_requests
options.description: Immediately retry failed requests to AWS services once. This option does not affect the normal Fluent Bit retry mechanism with backoff. Instead, it enables an immediate retry with no delay for networking errors, which may help improve throughput when there are transient/random networking issues.

options.name: log_retention_days
options.description: If set to a number greater than zero, and newly create log group's retention policy is set to this many days. Valid values are: [1, 3, 5, 7, 14, 30, 60, 90, 120, 150, 180, 365, 400, 545, 731, 1827, 3653]

options.name: endpoint
options.description: Specify a custom endpoint for the CloudWatch Logs API

options.name: sts_endpoint
options.description: Specify a custom endpoint for the STS API, can be used with the role_arn parameter

options.name: external_id
options.description: Specify an external ID for the STS API, can be used with the role_arn parameter if your role requires an external ID.

options.name: metric_namespace
options.description: Metric namespace for CloudWatch EMF logs

options.name: metric_dimensions
options.description: Metric dimensions is a list of lists. If you have only one list of dimensions, put the values as a comma seperated string. If you want to put list of lists, use the list as semicolon seperated strings. If your value is 'd1,d2;d3', we will consider it as [[d1, d2],[d3]].

options.name: profile
options.description: AWS Profile name. AWS Profiles can be configured with AWS CLI and are usually stored in $HOME/.aws/ directory.

outputs.name: kinesis_firehose
outputs.description: Send logs to Amazon Kinesis Firehose

options.name: region
options.description: The AWS region of your delivery stream

options.name: delivery_stream
options.description: Firehose delivery stream name

options.name: time_key
options.description: Add the timestamp to the record under this key. By default the timestamp from Fluent Bit will not be added to records sent to Kinesis.

options.name: time_key_format
options.description: strftime compliant format string for the timestamp; for example, the default is '%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%S'. This option is used with time_key.

options.name: role_arn
options.description: ARN of an IAM role to assume (ex. for cross account access).

options.name: endpoint
options.description: Specify a custom endpoint for the Firehose API

options.name: sts_endpoint
options.description: Custom endpoint for the STS API.

options.name: external_id
options.description: Specify an external ID for the STS API, can be used with the role_arn parameter if your role requires an external ID.

options.name: compression
options.description: Compression type for Firehose records. Each log record is individually compressed and sent to Firehose. 'gzip' and 'arrow' are the supported values. 'arrow' is only an available if Apache Arrow was enabled at compile time. Defaults to no compression.

options.name: log_key
options.description: By default, the whole log record will be sent to Firehose. If you specify a key name with this option, then only the value of that key will be sent to Firehose. For example, if you are using the Fluentd Docker log driver, you can specify `log_key log` and only the log message will be sent to Firehose.

options.name: auto_retry_requests
options.description: Immediately retry failed requests to AWS services once. This option does not affect the normal Fluent Bit retry mechanism with backoff. Instead, it enables an immediate retry with no delay for networking errors, which may help improve throughput when there are transient/random networking issues.

options.description: AWS Profile name. AWS Profiles can be configured with AWS CLI and are usually stored in $HOME/.aws/ directory.

options.name: host
options.description: Host Address

options.name: port
options.description: host Port

options.name: aws_shared_credentials_file
options.description: Path to the AWS shared credentials file.

options.name: aws_config_file
options.description: Path to the AWS default configuration file.

options.name: json_date_format
options.description: Specify the format of the date, supported formats: double, iso8601 (e.g: 2018-05-30T09:39:52.000681Z), java_sql_timestamp (e.g: 2018-05-30 09:39:52.000681, useful for AWS Athena), and epoch.

options.name: json_date_key
options.description: Specifies the name of the date field in output.

options.name: total_file_size
options.description: Specifies the size of files in S3. Maximum size is 50GB, minimum is 1MB

options.name: upload_chunk_size
options.description: This plugin uses the S3 Multipart Upload API to stream data to S3, ensuring your data gets-off-the-box as quickly as possible. This parameter configures the size of each part in the upload. The total_file_size option configures the size of the file you will see in S3; this option determines the size of chunks uploaded until that size is reached. These chunks are temporarily stored in chunk_buffer_path until their size reaches upload_chunk_size, which point the chunk is uploaded to S3. Default: 5M, Max: 50M, Min: 5M.

options.name: upload_timeout
options.description: Optionally specify a timeout for uploads. Whenever this amount of time has elapsed, Fluent Bit will complete an upload and create a new file in S3. For example, set this value to 60m and you will get a new file in S3 every hour. Default is 10m.

options.name: bucket
options.description: S3 bucket name.

options.name: region
options.description: AWS region.

options.name: role_arn
options.description: ARN of an IAM role to assume (ex. for cross account access).

options.name: endpoint
options.description: Custom endpoint for the S3 API.

options.name: sts_endpoint
options.description: Custom endpoint for the STS API.

options.name: canned_acl
options.description: Predefined Canned ACL policy for S3 objects.

options.name: compression
options.description: Compression type for S3 objects. 'gzip' and 'arrow' are the supported values. 'arrow' is only an available if Apache Arrow was enabled at compile time. Defaults to no compression. If 'gzip' is selected, the Content-Encoding HTTP Header will be set to 'gzip'.

options.name: content_type
options.description: A standard MIME type for the S3 object; this will be set as the Content-Type HTTP header.

options.name: store_dir
options.description: Directory to locally buffer data before sending. Plugin uses the S3 Multipart upload API to send data in chunks of 5 MB at a time- only a small amount of data will be locally buffered at any given point in time.

options.name: store_dir_limit_size
options.description: S3 plugin has its own buffering system with files in the `store_dir`. Use the `store_dir_limit_size` to limit the amount of data S3 buffers in the `store_dir` to limit disk usage. If the limit is reached, data will be discarded. Default is 0 which means unlimited.

options.name: s3_key_format
options.description: Format string for keys in S3. This option supports strftime time formatters and a syntax for selecting parts of the Fluent log tag using a syntax inspired by the rewrite_tag filter. Add $TAG in the format string to insert the full log tag; add $TAG[0] to insert the first part of the tag in the s3 key. The tag is split into parts using the characters specified with the s3_key_format_tag_delimiters option. Add $INDEX to enable sequential indexing for file names. Adding $INDEX will prevent random string being added to end of keywhen $UUID is not provided. See the in depth examples and tutorial in the documentation.

options.name: s3_key_format_tag_delimiters
options.description: A series of characters which will be used to split the tag into parts for use with the s3_key_format option. See the in depth examples and tutorial in the documentation.

options.name: auto_retry_requests
options.description: Immediately retry failed requests to AWS services once. This option does not affect the normal Fluent Bit retry mechanism with backoff. Instead, it enables an immediate retry with no delay for networking errors, which may help improve throughput when there are transient/random networking issues.

options.name: use_put_object
options.description: Use the S3 PutObject API, instead of the multipart upload API

options.name: send_content_md5
options.description: Send the Content-MD5 header with object uploads, as is required when Object Lock is enabled

options.name: preserve_data_ordering
options.description: Normally, when an upload request fails, there is a high chance for the last received chunk to be swapped with a later chunk, resulting in data shuffling. This feature prevents this shuffling by using a queue logic for uploads.

options.name: log_key
options.description: By default, the whole log record will be sent to S3. If you specify a key name with this option, then only the value of that key will be sent to S3.

options.name: external_id
options.description: Specify an external ID for the STS API, can be used with the role_arn parameter if your role requires an external ID.

options.name: static_file_path
options.description: Disables behavior where UUID string is automatically appended to end of S3 key name when $UUID is not provided in s3_key_format. $UUID, time formatters, $TAG, and other dynamic key formatters all work as expected while this feature is set to true.

options.name: storage_class
options.description: Specify the storage class for S3 objects. If this option is not specified, objects will be stored with the default 'STANDARD' storage class.

options.name: profile
options.description: AWS Profile name. AWS Profiles can be configured with AWS CLI and are usually stored in $HOME/.aws/ directory.
